patterns_discovered.description: Component wraps MuiCheckbox with FormControlLabel and FormControl for enhanced styling and functionality
onChange handler converts native event to boolean value, providing cleaner API than native checkbox
Uses MUI's styled() utility for custom styling with nested selectors and theme integration
Extends CheckboxInputBaseProps and accepts CheckboxProps with specific properties omitted to maintain API control
Component includes support for indeterminate checkbox state alongside checked/unchecked

gotchas_discovered.description: onChange handler extracts boolean from event.target.checked, requiring consumers to expect boolean instead of synthetic event
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: JSDoc clearly documents the simplified API

gotchas_discovered.description: Uses variant='standard' which may differ from default Material UI form patterns
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Explicit variant choice suggests intentional styling decision

gotchas_discovered.description: CheckboxProps spread after specific props, allowing override of controlled properties
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Omit type explicitly prevents spreading controlled properties (checked, onChange, etc.)

approach_outcome.summary: CheckboxInput component successfully created as a Material UI wrapper with custom styling and simplified API
key_accomplishments: Component properly extends CheckboxInputBaseProps base type
Material UI Checkbox wrapped with FormControlLabel for label integration
Custom styled wrapper with hover effects and theme integration
Simplified onChange API converting native event to boolean
Support for error states, helper text, and indeterminate state
Proper TypeScript typing with props interface and documentation

recommendations.recommendation: Add unit tests for CheckboxInput covering checked/unchecked/indeterminate states, onChange handler behavior, and error/helperText display
Ensure CheckboxInputBaseProps type definition in ./types file is well documented with all inherited properties
Verify styling (e.g., fontSize '0.875rem', margin: 0) is consistent with other form input components in the codebase
Verify ARIA attributes are properly handled by Material UI and test with screen readers for indeterminate state
Consider adding example usage or Storybook story to demonstrate CheckboxProps override capability and state combinations
